description: A bearish reversal pattern characterized by higher highs and higher lows that converge into a narrowing wedge sloping upward. Despite rising prices, momentum is weakening, leading to eventual downside break.

structure: Both upper and lower trendlines must slope upward
Requires at least 5 touches total (2-3 touches on each trendline)
Pattern duration: typically 3-6 months on daily charts, 1-4 weeks on 4H
Slope of lower trendline must be steeper than upper trendline (creates narrowing)
Forms after extended uptrend or near end of rally
volume: Volume must decline progressively as pattern develops (key characteristic)
Each rally within wedge should show weaker volume than previous
Decreasing volume indicates weakening buying pressure despite higher prices
Strong volume spike on downside break confirms pattern validity
indicators: RSI showing bearish divergence is critical (lower highs on RSI while price makes higher highs)
MACD histogram should show declining peaks (momentum weakening)
Stochastic making lower highs while price makes higher highs
Momentum indicators turning down while still inside wedge warns of breakdown
timeframe: Very reliable on daily and weekly charts
Less reliable on short timeframes due to frequent false wedges

invalidation_signals: Volume increasing during rallies (strong buying = bullish, not bearish)
Price breaks upward through top trendline (becomes ascending triangle or continuation)
No bearish divergence on RSI/MACD (reduces probability significantly)
Trendlines not converging (parallel lines = channel, not wedge)
Fewer than 5 touchpoints = insufficient pattern formation
Pattern forms in downtrend (rising wedges need prior uptrend to reverse)
Wedge too short in duration (<3 weeks on daily) = likely just consolidation
common_mistakes: Confusing with ascending triangle (which has flat top resistance, not sloping upward)
Ignoring volume requirement - declining volume is essential for wedge validity
Missing bearish divergence - this is the key warning signal
Trying to short inside the wedge before breakdown (premature entry)
Drawing trendlines incorrectly - need clear convergence
Expecting immediate breakdown - wedges can extend for months

trade_setup.entry: Enter short on break and close below lower wedge trendline with volume
trade_setup.stop_loss: Place above recent swing high or above upper wedge trendline
trade_setup.target: Measure wedge base (widest part), project that distance downward from breakdown point
